About.paragraph: Founded in February 2022, Justice For The Oppressed is a non-profit organization aiming to bring justice to Muslim minorities in Xinjiang, China.
Why: Spread awareness through our social media campaign
Encourage youth to take action by presenting to their schools
Raise $1,000 by June 30th to support the movement

Features.title: Who is Affected?
Features.text: Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities in Xinjiang, China, including Kazakhs and Uzbeks.

Features.title: What is Happening?
Features.text: Muslim minorities in China are being unjustly imprisoned in internment camps where they are physically, emotionally, and sexually abused until they lose their religion and culture.

Features.title: Where is it Happening?
Features.text: In Xinjiang which is the northwestern region of China. Xinjiang borders Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Tajikistan to the northwest, Pakistan and India to the southwest, Mongolia to the northeast, Russia to the north, and Afghanistan to the west.

Features.title: When did it start?
Features.text: It started in April of 2017 and is still ongoing.

Features.title: Why is it happening?
Features.text: The Chinese government feels threatened by the large Muslim population in Xinjiang because of potential separatism of the region from China. Losing Xinjiang harms China’s Belt and Road Initiative, which aims to create more trading routes between China and neighboring countries. However, they claim that their “re-education” camps prevent religious extremism, separatism, and international terrorism.
